strapiPost.title: Fayetteville Prepares For Nelson Hackett Celebration
strapiPost.content:
The City of Fayetteville will unveil a new historical marker and street renaming in honor of Nelson Hackett with a ceremony and celebration at the Pryor Center and Downtown Square this Friday, Jun 16, from 4-7:30p.

  • Nelson Hackett's 1841 escape from slavery in Fayetteville and extradition from Canada played a significant role in American abolition and emancipation, even going on to influence international relations and law. His story has been preserved by the U of A's Nelson Hackett Project and the Black Heritage Preservation Commission.
  • Following the ceremony, a reception will be held at the Juke Joint exhibit in the atrium of the Pryor Center from 6:30-7:30p, featuring music from Delta bluesman Keith Johnson and refreshments from local bakery Rollin' in the Dough.

Learn more about Nelson Hackett and the event HERE.
